headline: Homemade Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef
description: Top spaghetti or your favorite pasta with this mom's meaty spaghetti sauce that's oh-so easy to make, and ready in just over an hour.

video.description: There's nothing like classic spaghetti and meat sauce to bring people together around the dinner table. The homemade spaghetti sauce with ground beef recipe in this video will satisfy all your classic Italian comfort food cravings.
video.name: How to Make Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef

name: Homemade Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and green pepper in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until meat is browned and crumbly and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain grease.
Stir diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the pan. Season with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer spaghetti sauce for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was passed down from my mother and I use it all the time! Delicious!
This recipe turned out great . Added a pinch of sugar my grandmother use to do when she made as kids.
I'm making this now. I think my onions were getting old, so I'm trying to spice it up a bit more. Red pepper flakes and chili powder, bit of sugar, worechester sauce.

I guess I didn't realize that delicious homemade spaghetti sauce could be made so easily! The only change I made was omitting the green peppers since every one of my family members aren't fans of them including myself. However, I do think the sauce could've actually been even better had I not left them out but the sauce was still extremely delicious without them too! Next time I think I'll experiment a bit with ingredients based on others suggestions in the comments but I wanted to rate the recipe this time without a bunch of changes. I 100% agree with others when they say homemade spaghetti sauce is far superior to even the most expensive store bought sauces! This is a keeper.
The sauce was very easy to make and taste great
I thought the spaghetti sauce was very delicious and tasted good to eat.
Great recipe! I used this sauce for a lasagna dish and it was delicious!
Have used this recipe (or similar) for quite some time. Always perfect.. I add ground italian sausage for certain recipes like lasagna.
This was delicious! I would totally recommend this recipe to anyone looking for some great spaghetti!
The best meat sauce! Simple to make. I use three 12 oz cans of tomato sauce, instead of what the recipe recommends (I don't change anything else). I still make this meat sauce at least once a month.
The family loved it! I’ll be making this all the time. Thank you so much.
Good, easy, cheap to make. You probably have the ingredients on hand!
Easy and delicious
Awesome recipe! the newest addition to my collection. I seasoned the beef and let it marinate for a few hours... added an extra punch. I also used Tomato sauce with basil, garlic, and oregano.
Delicious and easy. I used McCormick’s Italian Blend Seasoning which has both oregano and basil along with rosemary, thyme & sage.
Ever since I discovered this recipe several years ago, it's the only spaghetti and meat sauce recipe I use - I have it memorized. My friends and family think I'm a genius!
I've made this,I add mushrooms as well. My don is a picky eater so i finely chop the vegetables. I also add pepperoni . Delicious.
My husband likes it. And he doesn't like spaghetti sauce or tomatoes.
Excellent! Very easy to prepare. I used ground turkey instead of beef. We really enjoyed it. Cheryl
I add grated celery if I have it onhand.
I can't believe how some so simple was sooooo delicious. I confess I didn't drain the fat, and it cooked a bit longer (as I wasn't home and my partner forgot) but it was amazingly delicious!!@
I think if I made it again I would add some Italian sausage for a bit more flavor, but pretty good recipe!

Amazing, imo I take 1 whole onion, green pepper, garlic and I sauté then I purée it in blender , then I continue to make as it states but I then add another onion for texture then add the purée mixture back into my sauce for even more added flavor ! Also use fresh basil! Also no need for tomato paste with my method the purée mixture acts as a thickener as well!

I love this recipe! I've been tweaking it to my taste along the way, and it's an easy recipe to tweak :) I've even made it without the bell peppers (because I didn't realize the one in my fridge had gone bad), and it was great! My dad and stepmom are older and like easy recipes to cook, and they are also in love with it! I always have some in the freezer ready to go for a quick dinner or pizza sauce. The one thing I might suggest is that it can be very thick, so if you want a little more sauciness, consider adding an extra small can of tomato sauce. I did that when I took some out of the freezer for use on pizza, and it worked out great!
For some reason i forgot how to make it so i search and end finding this recipe it end up really delicious

Since I did make a couple of changes, I'm giving it a 4. Very tasty sauce. What I did differently was also used some hot Italian sausage, used San Marzano tomatoes, sauteed mushrooms separately and added them halfway through the simmer. I used Italian seasoning and added fresh basil before serving. I tasted it and thought it was slightly acidic, so added a little brown sugar. Years ago I made my sauce in a similar way!

So good! I’m always meh on spaghetti sauce but I found this to be delicious although I made a couple changes. I put about an ounce of diced pecorino romano in after reading a recommendation to add parm; added during the adding of tomato sauces. I also had a weird mix of tomato cans at home. So I used 28 oz of tomato sauce, 16 oz of Rotel diced tomato and green chili, and 6 oz of tomato paste. The green chili added a subtle kick that really added more depth of flavor, as did the cheese. Will make again for sure!

made a few adjustments to this recipe. We used Italian sausage and ground beef. Also added mushrooms and green peppers. One small shake of hot red pepper flakes . Turned out really good. Thank you for the recipe.
It is a simple nice recipe. I added mushrooms and cut black olives and that made it a "wow" flavour. Superb.

I used San Marzano hand crushed tomatoes with the paste, sautéed mushrooms, home grown fresh herbs, and added a splash of red wine. Everything else was as the recipe called for. It just doesn’t get any better.
Love this recipe. The sauce is even tastier the next day.
Wow! This is truly great spaghetti sauce. Made no changes to the recipe and was amazed at just how good it is. Definitely a keeper.

This spaghetti sauce tastes INCREDIBLE plus it is SUPER EASY TO MAKE! I made this sauce exactly as the recipe was written .., perfecto! I make it on top of the stove, however (as the recipe states), this sauce can also be made in the crockpot. This is our new favorite spaghetti sauce, for sure!
Great love it easy to make
I enjoyed this very quick and simple recipe my kids love it too I did tweak it a little adding mushrooms and beef sausage with side salad but this was great thank you lots
Easy to follow recipe, and everyone loves it.
The recipe was great. My family enjoyed it and we would definitely eat it again.
Used more peppers
The spaghetti came out great! I followed the recipe and add more seasoning (onion power, pepper flakes, Italian seasoning, rosemary, basil and a bay leaf ) will definitely make it again.
I'll never buy spaghetti sauce again!! This recipe is so simple. I like spicy, so I added a sliced jalapeno to the meat . So delicious!! Thanks for sharing!!
Easy for beginners
This recipe is very easy and tasty
This is simirto how my Mom made it and I added mushrooms.
Made it just like it says in the recipe. Daaalicious!
If needed, parmesan cheese also helps to thicken the sauce. Great recipe!

I love how easy this recipe is. I tweak it to my own liking. I add mushrooms and throw in some extra bottled sauce because my husband loves a lot of sauce. I strongly suggest adding just a LITTLE bit of sugar. To balance out the acidity.
Added red pepper flakes just because we kick a little kick to our sauce. I will definitely be making this again.
Was a hit. Made with ground moose. Because I had no sauce on hand, I subbed crushed tomatoes.
My recipe almost but leave the garlic out and add Italian seasoning. I use seasoning blend instead of cutting up onions and bell peppers.
Doubled the recipe, added 1 lb of sausage. 8 oz more Mirepoix, and fresh herbs. Great base for a beginner sauce. With regards Chef Len

Mmm, this was good! My only little tweaks, probably not needed but to suit my tastes, was to use whole peeled tomatoes instead of diced, and it add a bit of cayenne flakes because spicy is good :) Thank you for this awesome recipe!

Great recipe! Wanna try this one. Thanks for sharing. Would like to share this too, Panlasang Makabayan food restaurant with a twist! Get your Pinoy food favorites and freshly baked bread only here at Ka Tunying's Cafe and Restaurant!" https://katunyings.com/
I added half fire roasted and half rotel tomatoes plus 1/4 cup parmesan as someone recommended in comments. I also did half Italian sausage and half beef. So so good!
Good
added mushrooms
I used Impossible ground beef, and skipped the bell pepper. It was fantastic.

Love this recipe! I was hesitant about trying it because there are so few ingredients so I was worried it wouldnt have much taste, but it is delicious! I did modify it a little by adding 2 stalks of celery, 3 teaspoons of brown sugar, a pinch of cayenne flakes, used italian spices and added extra salt and pepper. Definitely will make it again!
Easy quick recipe! I added a teaspoon of sugar, a splash of wine, coconut aminos, local spaghetti sauce seasonings, and a little Colby cheese
Fan freaking tastic
Hands down you did that
My favorite spaghetti recipe. I always add half a cup of red wine to the sauce before simmering it for an hour, it adds great flavor.
Most aunties are obsessed with eating spaghetti, like Kristle (Reesey) and Karen, and some cousins, like Marian, who thinks she's beautiful, and Melanie, who loves wearing black.
Good easy recipe for the week! I did make some changes. I am not a fan of bell pepper in my sauce so I left that out. I did add mushrooms and Italian seasoning. It came out great!

Perfect for what it is. I make this every year for a Boy Scout trip. The boys go caving all day, I stay back at the camp and cook this. Hot spaghetti dinner for 40 hungry cavers is just what they need!

It was...good. I love green olives so I added a jar at the sauce step. I only added a little green pepper though. But maybe the green pepper and olives didn't work together, I don't know. I think I will try the sugar and cream suggested by hironda next time.

I started out following the original recipe, but then used a red pepper instead, and Italian seasoning blend- about 2.5T. I added 2t brown sugar and parm rind plus some crushed red pepper while it simmered. I added over time probably about 3 cups pasta water while it simmered because I didn’t want it too thick- 1/2 c at a time. It came out excellent! I think next time, I’ll sauté up some pepperoni and cut them into bits to add on top at the end for texture and flavor (thanks to inspiration from Guy Fieri’s lasagna recipe). I agree this is a great base recipe you can adapt to your own liking. I’ll probably add a glug of Cabernet to sauce when simmering too next time.
Way too much oregano!! Won’t use again.
Add mushrooms
Just ok, I'll probably use a different one next time.
Easy to make and very tasty, but the sauce was too thick. Next time I make it I'll use less tomato paste.

I love this recipe except for the green pepper and regular pepper. I had made this before and didn’t like all the black pepper so I reduced it to 1/8 Th teaspoon black pepper and added 8 oz of sliced mushrooms. YUM??

We made this recipe today. We substituted the ground beef with ground turkey. Wecooked the meat separately. We just threw every everything else in the pot and let it simmer. This turned out very good!

My Italian recipe is one can tomato paste with water, one can tomato soup with water, basil to taste, garlic to taste, 1/2 tsp. of sugar, 1/4 tsp. cinnamon, oregano to taste, salt and pepper to taste. Add beef broth to thin. Omit broth and add a small can of crushed tomatoes if desired. It's a taste-as-you-go recipe and that's how the Chicago Italian lady showed me how to make it forty years ago.
I kind of expected more form this. Very dishearten
This is great. I used it for lasagna and used half ground beef and half ground sausage. I also used about half the amount of tomato paste to cut down on acidity. An excellent recipe!

a spoonful of sugar realy helps round out the acidity of the tomatoes, and instead draining the fat (where all the flavor is) i skim it off the top of the sauce once evrything is added, before the spices. A little more work but defnitely worth it to preserve as much flavor as possible

I’ve been making this recipe for years now, and each time, it never fails. It’s super easy to make, so even amateur cooks can impress. My kids and I aren’t big fans of cooked peppers so I usually substitute it for chopped zucchini. In fact, I have a batch simmering on the stove right now. Photos to come!
This is my go to recipe! It makes enough for us to eat and I freeze the rest for an easy dinner night! The recipe is perfect as presented!
Made it exactly. Was really good. Made it twice already and will use it again when I want something easy to make and goood!
This is the first time I ever made anything From a recipe , I am amazed , this is GREAT !!!
This was the most bland spaghetti sauce I've ever tasted. It tasted like tomato sauce with ground beef. It needed five times the spices to make it edible.

Not sure where to post this, but with all the great reviews, I thought this was the place. I basically follow this recipe, but like my sauces thick, so i add mushrooms, grated carrots and grated zucchini....

I thought it was ok, but hubby really liked it. I did cheat and used a premade sauce. I thought the meat was a tad bit bland although I added some sugar. Next time I will try marinating the meat before cooking it.
Wonderful recipe I added cremini mushrooms grated the onion added sun dried tomatoes 1 tsp sugar and 1 teas crushed chili flakes added some chic broth so I could simmer longer and five stars.
Made it as is and it was awesome.

I am 67 and have always made my spaghetti sauce from scratch. I don't use spices or seasoning, but decided to give this recipe a try. My family and grandkids have always loved my sauce, but when I made this sauce this week, everyone said it was the best sauce ever

Love the sauce!! Very delicious!!

I Made twice!! Girlfriends love it!!

Delicious and easy! I followed other reviewers’ advice and browned the meat first, draining it before adding the onion, peppers, and garlic. I also added about a teaspoon of sugar while the sauce was simmering. The result was great! This makes a lot of sauce, definitely enough for a whole 16oz box of pasta.

Wonderful AND simple! I do add the teaspoon of sugar and might try adding rosemary...my husband’s Italian mother made a sauce with similar ingredients that included rosemary, which I like. But excellent as is!

This meat sauce was perfect and easy to fix. I added some water because we let it simmer for about 4 hours and the water all cooked out. We put a lot of mushrooms and a little more than a pound of ground beef. We also had an Italian blend of seasonings and I only used 2 teaspoons. This replaced the oregano And the other herb the recipe listed. We had dried garlic which worked fine. We also threw in a over ripe tomato before it went bad. This recipe is hard to mess up. Will make again.
Adding mushrroms & black olives was an improvement.
VENISON! I had to use up 2lbs of venison. I doubled the batch, that was my only change. Everyone loved it!

I have used this for years and it is by far my favorite recipe for spaghetti sauce. I make it exactly except that I add 1 or 2 jalapeños with 1 1/3 pound of ground beef and it turns out great every time!
Easiest and best sauce I've ever made. Makes a lot. Good bye, Ragu, Prego,, etc.
It came out pretty good for an old first timer. Easy to make.
Standard Recipe. Nothing special.
Great home style sauce. Easy to make.
Great sauce!
I like thick beefy sauce and this has become our go to when the family wants spaghetti. Even the most finnicky of our grandchildren will eat it.

item.name: Homemade Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef
